content.raw:
Pretty sure you could restore the settings \(call `Tab.restore_builtin_save_data` or whatever\) from `Tab.__init__` because all the relevant UI elements exist by the end of object construction. We only go through the complicated set of methods in `DeviceTab` because we want the user to control part of `DeviceTab.__init__` and we need to ensure things happen in the right order. I don't see that we have that constraint here because a user/developer shouldn't be doing anything that would require that separation.

EDIT: Oh I see, that doesn't catch the case of restoring front panel settings from a H5 file when BLACS is running...
